title.narrative: DISAGGREGATED AND GENDER-SENSITIVE DATA

description.narrative: National capacity to provide child-sensitive social protection services and to review its policy or develop related legislation is strengthened, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Human Rights Institutions, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable groups, in particular children and women, benefit from improved social protection systems guided by generated evidence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National capacity to provide child-sensitive social protection services and to review its policy or develop related legislation isstrengthened

description.narrative: In ;2021, UNICEF supported government to disseminate MICS6 results, fostering the use data use on key indicators of well-being of children to shape realistic development policies for improvement of their lives. From an inclusion perspective, so that no one is left behind, UNICEF collaborated with government in the organization ofseveral workshops on the use, interpretation, and analysis of data in the context of the III National Statistics Council. These sessions promoted national dialogue on the production of data and statistical information, raised awareness of the need for an evidence planning culture, and demonstrated the importance of information for decision-making. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
